intro: Tithymalus uniflorus, commonly known as the single-flower tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, with a distinctive central disc surrounded by ray florets. Tithymalus uniflorus is often found in grassland habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
